verse: Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you? – 1 Corinthians 6:19
devotional: God created your body with purpose and dignity. Just as you train your muscles to grow stronger, let each workout be a reminder that your discipline honors the body He gave you. In caring for your health, you also make room for His Spirit to work powerfully in and through you.
reflection: Before your workout today, take a moment to thank God for your body. Reflect on how your fitness journey can be an act of worship, discipline, and preparation for His calling.

verse: But they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles. – Isaiah 40:31
devotional: Rest and endurance both come from God. When your body feels weak, your spirit can remain strong. Remember that even in fatigue, God offers you a supernatural source of energy that goes beyond your physical limits.
reflection: Whether today is a rest day or a push day, pause to ask God for strength that goes beyond muscle. Invite Him into your workout, your goals, and your mindset.

verse: Whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God. – 1 Corinthians 10:31
devotional: Your fitness is more than a personal goal—it’s an opportunity to glorify God through focus, perseverance, and stewardship. When you show up with intentionality, you reflect His character and excellence.
reflection: Ask yourself today: am I moving out of vanity or purpose? Let your training time become sacred space to praise, reflect, and grow with Christ.
